DOC.brief_summary: My Care My Call ( MCMC ) innovative , peer-led telephone intervention design empower adult chronic spinal cord injury ( SCI ) self-management primary health care need prevent secondary condition . In randomized controlled trial , participant assign MCMC intervention receive taper call Peer Health Coach ( PHC ) six month . PHCs experience , empathetic peer mentor live SCI act supporter , role model , advisor , provide goal-setting support , motivation , education , resource referral participant . Participants complete survey baseline , 2 , 4 , 6-months , well qualitative exit phone interview . It hypothesize MCMC : 1 ) Increase participant ' self-advocacy health care interaction reflect increase three domain self-advocacy : assertiveness , illness education , potential mindful non-adherence , 2 ) Increase participant ' self-efficacy health care navigation , preference involvement , satisfaction primary care physician ( PCP ) , 3 ) Increase health relate quality life medical social support compare receive usual care . Additional secondary hypothesis state MCMC intervention increase access primary care use preventive screening service compare receive usual care .
